*Q:* What is Google Gadgets for Linux

*A:* It's a platform for running desktop gadgets under Linux. Please read QuickStart for detailed introduction.


*Q:* How to build and install it on Ubuntu 8.04

*A:* You need install various development packages, including: libgtk2.0-dev, libmozjs-dev, libxul-dev, libcurl4-openssl-dev, libgstreamer0.10-dev, libgstreamer-plugins-base0.10-dev, libdbus-1-dev, libxml2-dev, librsvg2-dev. Other dependent packages will be installed along with these packages. And some user reported that the default prefix /usr/local doesn't work, because of library linking issue. So it's better to use --prefix=/usr when running configure script to override the default prefix value. For detailed instructions about build and installation, please read HowToBuild
